review: THANK YOU OSCAR INSURANCE FOR REFERRING ME TO DR. MEHRBAN
BEST, BEST, BEST in every regard. Bed side manner, attendance, care for practice
AETNA'S BEST DOCTOR. WE ARE GLAD HE ACCEPTS OUR INSURANCE
I have been referred by Aetna Book and I am very happy
He is the Only OSCAR HEALTH PROVIDER I could find to accept my insurance. BEST DOCTOR
Wonderful Experience. Fast, No nonsense, always available, always caring. THANK YOU BLUE CROSS FOR HAVING THIS PROVIDER IN YOUR PANEL
NUMBER ONE. LOVE HIM. Kind, caring, giving, educated, real physician
Recommend highly A+++. I was referred by UCLA and he was in my insurance booklet. I was surprised to talk to kind and caring doctor on the phone personally and care was great. Happy

Referred to Dr. Mehrban by a friend. I found he was in my Anthem provider list. He saw me immediately without delay. He is respectable and extremely nice. His education is much above average and his bed side manner is great. If you are looking for a REAL DOCTOR that does not treat you like bunch of dealers in fish market he is the best. Takes time and pays lots and lots of attention to you and your care
I highly recommend Dr. Mehrban. Knowledge A+, Bed Side Manner A+, Care of Patient A+, Courtesy A+...Best of the Best

Dr. J cared from my mother prior to her passing and she has cared for me since 2000. While her scheduling secretary Charley is extremely rude, the doctor herself is brilliant and caring and well worth the effort to get past the unpleasantness to see her. Dr. J. is a consummate pro and her office is equipped with the latest diagnostics and tech support staff. Highly recommend Dr. J!!

A top notch doctor. Wonderful, caring, and very smart woman.. Takes her time to explain everything to you. Makes sure that you understand from the beginning what is happening. I will recommend her to anyone.

Dr. J is one of a kind, my all-time favorite doctor. No, she's not the one to hold your hand when you're scared over a funny looking pimple, but she's a bulldog about finding and fixing the real problems. She's the one who knew I needed a pacemaker even though I looked healthy (unlike several doctors before her), and the one to order the CT scan that found my cancer at the earliest, curable stage. So, life saved twice, what more can you ask?
Dr. Judelson is an extremely thorough, super smart and caring doctor.

After being a great patient for 15 yrs with NO problem ever on my part, I called Dr. Judelson's office feeling ill & chest pains & wondered if I could see the doctor that day. Charlie, her very rude and 'love to be intimidating' secretary ABSOLUTELY REFUSED to allow me to come in to see Dr Judelson because she said I had a $135.00 balance (I did not know about) that was clearly an error on the part of my insurance co! I was APPALLED that she told me NO, I could NOT see the Dr! After a 15 year relationship, & with great insurance that pays 100% & never made an error before! I thought she was kidding at first. I begged her, & said I would pay whatever she asked me to pay upon arrival at the Dr's office-even cash! (I had NO other Dr!) She flatly & arrogantly denied me seeing the Dr, telling me this payment would have to go through a special office that was closed at the time & would need 3 days or so to process, & that MAYBE I could see Dr. AFTER that was all done-no guarantee! WOW!
really helpful, spent the time I needed and answered my questions

Dr. Judelson is brilliant and caring. Her bedside manner is bit like Woody Allen, entertaining and perfect if you are very bright and educate yourself about medicine, but she can be cryptic at times. If you are an intellectual, you will love her and her technical competence is outstanding. I would say her approach to medicine tends toward following the latest studies, doing lots of tests, using drugs and treating conditions, which I like.

Dr. Judelson is the most intelligent, resourceful physician I've ever known. She's solved problems that specialists in other areas were unable to resolve. She is thorough and a creative thinker. She can find a needle in a haystack! I cannot recommend her enough!

Dr. Debra Judelson is a brillant, wonderful and caring physician. My experience with her as well as her staff have been nothing but great. Dr. Judelson follows up on her patients, returns phone calls immediately and her assistant always calls in a timely fashion with lab results as well as taking care of prescription refills. Dr. Judelson is not a hand holding doctor and you will get the BEST medical attention ever. I recommend Cardiovascular Medical Group and especially Dr. Judelson.

From my experience, very smart and knowledgeable, but terrible personality...rude, cold, uncaring, haughty, egotistical and short-tempered. I found her to be very self-absorbed and practices defensively. If you want some understanding and comfort, this is probably not the doctor for you. If you are anxious or frightened, this is probably not the doctor for you. This is my opinion from my experience with her.
Rude, arrogant, an exaggerated sense of his own importance. Has the right credentials, but they don't nearly make up for his office and bedside manner. Would I trust my life with him? Heck no!!!!
Dr Swerdlow is a brilliant physician. He is patient and caring and answered all my questions completely. I am totally confident in his diagnosis and treatment. He is a total pleasure.

One of the worst Dr.'s I have ever been to. Forgetting for a moment how he is as a human being, bedside manner, etc., this is strictly how he is as a surgeon. I was 32 when I met Dr. Swerdlow and knew I had a heart condition. He was so sure that I didn't need a surgery and I had to urge him to prescribe another heart monitor, so he could see more results. He called me two weeks later when he got the results from my monitor, which showed a BPM that peaked at 294. He immediately said, "I'm wrong and you need surgery asap for SVT." A few weeks later, as he did have the sweetest assistant who fit me in right away, Dr. Swerdlow went in to do the surgery and 3 hours later was unsuccessful. A good Dr. would have gone back in another time, but I think he was too scared and his ego was too big to say "I failed!" I asked when we could schedule another surgery and he replied with, "you're fine." He tried me on one beta-blocker which brought out Bradycardia and then gave me the advice in his office, in front of my parents to "smoke weed," and wrote me off completely.
Since then I have had 3 more ablations by great, competent Dr's and am doing fantastic!
As far as I'm concerned his license should be revoked as he not only pays no attention to the Hippocratic Oath he is sworn by, but just does whatever he wants.
Worst Dr. EVER.

Dr. Swerdlow is a brilliant and compassionate physician and surgeon. He saved my husband's life when he was in ICU going into shock at a hospital across town 11 years ago. His subsequent surgeries and compassionate care changed the course of my husband's disease and his quality of life. We moved to another state last year, and with Dr. Swerdlow's gentle assistance, we are slowly transitioning our care to a doctor he knows and respects. We have tremendous faith in Dr. Swerdlow and his excellent team of professionals. His entire team over the years has been and continues to be top notch. I would refer anyone in need of excellent professional care to him.

I had a consultation with this Dr. today. He kept me waiting for 90 minutes. His nurse and staff repeatedly made excuses for him. There is no excuse to keep someone waiting for 90 minutes without explanation. I had to leave before seeing the Dr. His staff was very "apologetic". Unfortunately, apologies are useless when you spend 4 1/2 hours total with drive time waiting for a Dr. and never actually get to see him. There is no excuse for this.

Good doctor.. But, horrible bedside matter.... I was in the hospital for 6 days.. Found out the reason for the stay.. but, he was very rude and at one point left the room without a goodbye, or I will be back.. Seemed very irate.. I was a patient in a hospital bed not really knowing what to do. And he left me hanging. Will not recommend him to anyone.. By the way. I have waited for him to call me to say sorry. And still nothing.

Dr. Swerdlow is fantastic! I was treated by local cardiologists for almost 2 years before entering Cedar-Sinai and finding Dr. Swerdlow. Dr. Swerdlow gave me every imaginable test to determine my problem before recommending a pacemaker. He was able to go back and complete the procedure by implanting a pacemaker. Everyone in the hospital that day, from nurses to the Medtronics Rep, commented to me that they observed his work how lucky I was to have had him for the implant. I cannot say enough about Dr. Charles Swerdlow, his staff of nurses and technicians. Since I do not live close to Beverly Hills I have tried other cardiologists closer to home over the past 6 years and none come close to the care and support I received from Dr. Swerdlow and his staff. I would go back to him in a heartbeat even if it meant traveling 2,000 or 3,000 miles for his services. I would definitely recommend anyone with a heart problem to make the effort to seek him out and have him be your doctor.
Dr. Swerdlow is the best. The Medrontics cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) implanted by Dr. Swerdlow three years ago saved my husband's life. We are so very grateful that he is Dr. Swerdlow's patient.
Outstanding Doctor. Thorough and very dedicated. He is tops in his field and I highly recommend him.
Very thorough doctor. Interesting personality! Knows his stuff. I highly recommend.
Very caring and reassuring doctor. I've referred multiple friends and family.

I found him to be very kind and experienced. Was assigned to me through the ER at Cedars Sinai. As far as I'm concerned, he helped to save my life. Not sure about other review - he was out of network with my insurance but his office ulitimately worked it out where I paid nothing out of pocket. His office is wonderful. I am glad to have found him as my doctor.

Dr. Yashar and his staff are terrific. I have great confidence in his knowledge of the field. Additionally, he takes time and care with every patient, myself included. I have observed his manner with other patients and am very impressed. He is what a doctor should be. LEE
Distracted, disorganized, seems overwhelmed, staff is a shambles. Find someone else.

Dr. Drury is thorough, knowledgeable, caring, helpful, modest, hard-working, and humanistic. He kept my father alive for many years through many difficulties and he explained the real meaning of DNR when no one else seemed to be able to do so. He never panicked but only made adjustments to medication and/or treatment. His only limitation that I can see would be to wonder how long he will keep practicing.
The Best! and he also cares. (I've used him for 5 years and he has seen me through a lot.)

Dr. Drury has been my husband's physician for more than 20 years and mine for the past 10. Along with practicing good medicine, he consistently demonstrates his humanity and care for his chosen field by showing excellent follow up both in hospital care and by returning phone call. He demonstrates what all of us want in a physician.

Dr.Drury is the most amazing Doctor, not just for Cardiology, but for Internal medicine. He is extremely knowledgeable and caring.He has been my Doctor,and my family's, for twenty years.He has saved my life more than once, as well as my Mother and Brother in law, and other members of my family.
Very knowlegable and approachable. Easy to talk to. Excellent staff. On staff at Cedars-Sinai.

Excellent clinical knowledge, spent a great deal of time discussing my problems, staff very helpful, meticulous and complete physical exam, high-tech back-up (echocardiogram, CTAngiogram) avaiable, always easy to reach by phone or e-mail, replies quickly to questions.

Dr, Lew has seen my parent''s and husband and I for a long time. He is very easy to talk to and he takes time with you. If it wasn''t for Dr. Lew treating my parent''s they wouldn''t have lived as long as they did. My parent''s just loved him and so do we. He has a good staff very nice.
Absolutely the most superior care of any Dr. Takes time, listens, very empathetic, and great staff.
Unprofessional manager plus staff....not recommended.
Waited for 45 minutes to an hour for all appointments

Dr. Shapira is a brilliant, compassionate, and outgoing physician who goes out of his way to help his patients and seems to thoroughly enjoy his job. His enthusiasm is contageous. Being a physician myself, I consider myself incredibly critical of other docotrs. However, Dr. Shapira is the "best of the best" (which means a lot coming from me). A visit to Dr. Shapira essentially guarantees that you will receive the best, most thorough care, while also feeling completely comfortable througout the experience. Simply put, Dr. Shapira is pretty darn spectacular.
Dr. Shapira is by far the most professional and intelligent doctor I have ever seen! His knowledge of cardiac issues is unsurpassed. I highly recommend him!
Dr. Shapira is an amazing cardiologist. He has saved my son's father's life along with many of the men in the family as heart disease runs in the family. He is a very caring doctor.

Dr. Schapira is a doctors' doctor. He deeply cares about his patients, and his knowledge of his avenue of medicine is pinpoint. He has a wonderful bedside manner, and he is loved by all the nurses at Cedars Sinai. He is exactly what a doctor should be! He does what a doctor should do! Simply put, the best of the best.

Dr. Urman brushed off every medical concern i had and then told me i needed a psych exam because he couldn't find anything wrong with me. If you go to him looking for answers then goodluck because you won't get any. I have now been diagnosed with 8 chronic illnesses, 2 of which have the potential to be deadly. I would not recommend him to anyone. I was very disappointed by the care i received from him since most of his patients can't stop singing his praises. He was a bad and neglectful doctor who's ego was too big to admit he didn't know what was wrong (but writing me off as a psych patient was totally acceptable in his books). If you have any form of autonomic dysfunction, or suspect you do, do NOT see him.
Not only is smart and knowledgable but does his best to figure out what is best for his patient
Knowledgable on the latest in cardiac care and very empathetic and caring. We now know first hand that it is clearly worth paying more if a superb doctor is not in your network.
Very thorough, very caring and very qualified. Wonderful office and experience

An excellent doctor. Engages me when he talks to me, and takes a clear interest in listening to my concerns, and responds to them thoughtfully. He is extremely knowledgeable and seems well-read on the latest news in his field. Great bedside manner. I recommend unreservedly

Dr Urman is very knowlegable. He was very reassuring and has great bedside manners. Not only did I feel very safe with his knowledge and professionalism, but I also felt comfortable with his demeanor and friendliness. Highly recommended.

I've been seeing Dr Caren for over 10 years. I went through heart surgery with him as my cardiologist. I have 3 different doctors caring for various medical issues. He has demonstrated a superb understanding of heart related issues. He's always prepared to take time time in explaining my condition and doing it in a layman's terms. Most notably, Dr Caren's probably my favorite doctor because his bedside manner is so compassionate. He is a doctor's doctor with a wonderful way of dealing with the "heart".

Very knowledgeable and LISTENS!! Called (he called, not someone in his office) within a few days with results of tests. Have recommended others to him and they had positive experiences as well. Nice office staff.

Because my family has a history of heart disease, Dr. Caren is my primary physician so I see him at least once a year. He has proven to be extremely knowledgeable even in areas outside of his specialty, has a great bedside manner, and helped me to reduce my bad cholesterol by a whopping 50%. He is also an artist: a world class photographer whose pictures adorn the walls of parts of Cedars-Sinai Hospital. At Cedars, he is a long-time member of their Heart Institute. In my opinion, if you have cardiologic issues, you couldn't find a better doctor.

Dr. V is literally a life saver. I am a distance runner and was having palpitations. Everyone else blew it off to anxiety but she listened and took me seriously. Turns out I could have died running had I not had the problem fixed. Her technical skills are superb and I have since completed a marathon without symptoms and alive!
AMAZING EP very knowledgeable and compassionate. Highly recommended!

Dr. V is literally a life saver. I am a distance runner and was having palpitations. Everyone else blew it off to anxiety but she listened and took me seriously. Turns out I could have died running had I not had the problem fixed. Her technical skills are superb and I have since completed a marathon without symptoms and alive!
Excellent overall experience during a difficult time. Compassionate and caring doctor.

She spent only about 2 min with me, and she was on the phone the whole time. She told me that my pacemaker may be disconnected, which it was not! Then she left the room and never came back. I only went there to meet with her because I was looking for a new doctor. Not to be readjusted and scared to death. Even worse the office manager was completely unprofessional when I called to dispute my bill. She accused me of just not wanting to pay my bill within ten sec of talking to me. She wouldn't even give me her name, or let me talk to anyone else. This place is awful!!!!! Dangerous! Stay away!

she is an outstanding doctor. I have been having heart problems for the past two years and nobody could give me a formal diagnosis. I moved here in may and my pulmonologist and a different cardiologist recommended her to me so that I could get an EP study. I met her for the first time in september and 2 weeks later I was having the EP study done. She is extremely knowledgable and has outstanding bedside manner. She always answers my wuestions and if she does not know the answer right away she looks them up either right there on her iphone or she will look it up and call you or tell you at your next appointment. Even though I went to see her just for the EP study, I ended up choosing to stay with her and I do not regret my choice at all.
I am extremely satisfied the professionalism Dr. Mayeda and his Staff provide to my father. He always spends time with his patients and answers questions we have.

I am extremely satisfied the professionalism Dr. Mayeda and his Staff provide to my father. He always spends time with his patients and answers questions we have. I highly recommend him. He has been treating my father due to bad leg circulation and his condition has improved tremendously.
Dr. Mayeda is the most compassioante and caring physician that I have ever had the pleasure of using. He gives as much time as necessary, and does follow-up with patients.He is terrific!!!!
He is the best at what he does. He has treated our family members and we are extremely pleased with his ability.
Excellent doctor. Has a wonderful lab. He did my PFO closure and has be my doctor for 12 years now.

I went to Dr. Cohen for the first time for a physical yesterday, and could not be happier that I did. I was a nervous wreck (1st physical in years), he was relaxed & attentive. He spent over an hour discussing my history and concerns. Then called today to discuss my test results, and was willing to talk as long as I had questions. It's very convenient that he's also a cardiologist, because you don't have to go elsewhere for heart related tests/care if you need them. His attitude is perfect for worriers. While he recommended certain tests, he let me decide which to proceed with. Definitely aware of the mind-body connection which I really appreciated. Open to non-med interventions. Parking was $18. Overall my visit with him left me feeling very relieved, and very glad I finally have an answer for those forms that ask you to name your primary care doctor Highly recommend him!

Dr. Cohen is the best! I will never go to another doctor! Such a difference from other doctors that make you wait forever to see them, then make you feel rushed. Dr. Cohen takes enough time with you to answer all your questions and concerns. He also has a unique style, in that he tries to get your whole body healthy... not just put a "band-aid" on the problem. He is really a great doctor and I'm not getting paid to say this! I would highly recommend him to anyone.
Staff is helpful and courteous. Dr. Lepor is a leading edge professional who also does research and writes and teaches. He takes the time you need. He cares about his patients.
Dr. Lepor could not have been more patient, understanding, smart, easy to talk with, conscientous. He is the BEST!!!

Dr. Daniel Cruz is one of the finest doctors you will ever meet. He is very caring, pays full attention to you and listens to your problems. He is highly qualified with a M.D and also a Ph, D. Degree. He is also very compassionate and gives his utmost best to his patients. He is everything you expect in a great doctor. After my heart surgery at U.C.L.A over two years ago I feel very lucky to have him as my doctor. He genuinely cares for his patients and there is no doubt that he makes decisions keeping what is best for you in his mind. He has been a source of strength for me in my recovery. He is a wonderful and a special doctor. He is definitely one of the world’s top doctors. I recommend him with all my heart.

Wonderful Cardiologist. Dr Cruz saved my life with a heart transplant May 28,2010 at UCLA and when I was very sick in the hospital he was always there, always checked on me. Wonderful doctor with a great heart for people. He is patient, understanding, explains well, and will fight for your health. One of UCLA's finest!!
One of the best Doctors out their. Kindest and sweetest !!
Very caring, compassionate care.
Amazing experience. Loves to educate patients. Knows how to break down complex situations to their simplest forms so that I can understand my condition.
Very caring and complete. Could not be a better experience.

Dr. Badran is great she has been my son's cardiologist for the last year. She is very attentive and doesn't rush any appointments. She knows that heart defects are challenging to understand and has no problem whipping out a pen to draw exactly what she is talking about. I also love that I have her private # and email if I need to speak with her asap!!

Dr Badran is incredible, as is her staff! Every appointment my son's had, there hasn't been an unduly long wait, and everyone is so nice and helpful! Dr Bsdran is extremely knowledgeable in her field, yet she does NOT dismiss a parent's observation of their child. Very easy to talk to, and she's great with kids!
Dr Corday has been my Cardiologist for 29 years I had open heart valve surgery when I was 39 yrs old he was there for me the entire time he's loyalty to his patients is unmatched by any other Doctor.
great doctor! excellent bedside manner! we love Dr. Corday
Extremely bright, knowledge, and great bedside manner.
He is very smart and honest, glad to chose him as my cardiologist. Thank you and god bless
Best electrophysiologist in san diego, he is very honest. After seeing several doctors , I chose him and very happy that I did. He saved my life. Thank you

I went to him for the condition I had. At first he was going to send me for a CT angio and then without any reason he switched the test to a regular angio which is a procedure. He told me that the reason was because my insurance didn't approve the test but my insurance said that the doctor cancelled the request. When I asked him about it, he was dishonest with me and lied to me about this. He was also in a rush every time I went to him. Also when I went to two other doctors, they told me that the test he wrote (angio) for my condition is unnecessary. I would not recommend him at all. Avoid him.

Dr. Pashmforoush is very admirable for his true love for his patients. He is a noble human being and an excellent doctor. His wonderful manner always show his caring for his patients.With our great Love and respect to him and God bless him.

Best doctor ever. He is very knowledgeable and sweet. Staff are very good too. He doesn't like it when patients come in and self-diagnose themselves, like any other doctor. Let the doctor do his job! You can trust him.

I am a long time patient of Dr Chaikin. He is great. He has helped me with CHF, general health issues and even cancer. He is professional, courteous and very knowledgeable. His staff is equally great. I feel like family whenever I go to the office or talk over the phone. There is parking validation if you are more than an hour. i feel like the first reviewer has other issues going on with life. Dr Chaikin saved my life and has helped keep me going strong. We patients can be our own worst enemies. When we damage ourselves with our choices we blame the one trying to fix our problems.

Doctor is very slow moving and talking. Seems uninterested and bored. Personality is flat and unfriendly. Took minimal history. Physical was minimal. Parking was $9.00, no validation. Could not tell if he was knowledgeable because he said very little. Did not ilicit questions. Answers were brief and vague. Sorry, did not trust this doctor.

I FOUND DR RICHARD GOLD VERY THOROUGH. HE WAS CALM, ON TIME AND VERY PROFESSIONAL. HIS ENTIRE OFFICE WAS VERY HELPFUL AND PROFESSIONAL. ITS BEEN YEARS SINCE I HAVE EXPERIENCED SUCH GREAT CARE AND I AM SO THANKFUL FOR MY REFERRAL TO DR GOLD.

very well respected by his peers ( the md's often use him for their own physician), caring, conervative, great sense of humor, worked through a week worth of studies before diagnosing real ailment of my wife and then recommending procedure for rare defect. would recommend him highly.
I believe that he is. one of the best doctors in the world. God bless him
Dr Soleimani I a very smart doctor. He actually looks at his patients when he's talking to them. God bless this caring, professional human being.
The reason I've been a patient for so many years is simple. Dr. Kattan improved my health and, I can categorically characterize his effort to supply the best care as extraordinary.
staff is not friendly on the phone, not polite. Dr. Kattan himself has really poor bedside manner and RUDE!!!

I met Dr. Kattan several years ago when he was treating my father for heart problems. When my dad had to go into the hospital for brain surgery, we made Dr. Kattan my father’s primary physician. I found him to be extremely thorough through all of my fathers care and kept us informed on his day-to-day treatment. His exceptional concern and attention to all of my dad’s health issues convinced me that I should use Dr. Kattan as my own person internist. I have now been going to Dr. Kattan's office for a while and I am very happy that I made this choice.

Dr. David Kattan is a true caring Doctor!!! I travel all over the world with my job and he always makes time for me!! I have a fear of Doctors and he has helped me over come that fear and I look forward to seeing him when I am in town. it' is rare to find a doctor who truley cares from the heart!! I give him 10 Stars!!!

Dr.Kattan waltzed in 1 hr. late. I sat for 2 hrs. until finally left. Unprofessional, rude, horrible. No apology was ever given when I said I was leaving after sitting for 2 hrs? Do not use this Dr. unless you have all day to wait!
Good choice, saved my wife's life.
She is the best cardiologist. Very Knowledgeable. Great in diagnosis. Actually she saved my life.
Very professional and knowledgeable. Our whole family uses her, she is our favorite Doctor. Strongly recommend to everybody.

Knowledgeable and professional. I have been her patient for over 10 years with an arrhythmia. She has provided me with excellent care and is very attentive and sympathetic. I would not pick a different cardiologist.

Not a healer. Prescribed a new drug for my heart condition which caused me to retain fluids and placed me in the hospital one month later. She kept telling me that it wasn't the drug and said that I'm near death and I just need to be in a hospice. Once I stopped taking the drug when I found a new cardiologist my fluid retention stopped and I'm feeling tons better. Kaufman is a silent killer.
:((((((( very rude personality,poor bedside manners,not helpful at all
Very Cold Doctor. Lacks Manners. Seemed very Negative. Doesn't seem to care for the work she's in.
Very professional and kind. I highly recommend this doctor. I am a life long cardiac patient and rarely have found an office like this. Great staff! Great doctor!
Loved the Dr. and the nurse. The only complaint is that the two receptionists are loud and not very bright. No privacy is maintained regarding patient information.
Dr.Lee is a very good Dr. I needed a blood transfusion and he put me in the Hospital right away. I would Recommend him to everyone.

i called for to make a schedule and they told me that they have an afternoon availability. After all the hassle, the lady who is making a schedule lied!!! Matter worst, she doesnt even apologize. And this Rachel,is sooo rude the maximum level! No empathy at all!!! I was double checking the procedure that needed to be done and what needs to be done but she treated me like a dumb person and all she can say is " I told you already!" this girl has a big attitude problem. Staff will give you run arounds, and the doctor itself is not that helpful regarding your concern.

He sees his patients at two different locations. He's a GREAT doctor! However, I do have some complaints about some of his staff members. One of the ladies who works at the Medical Record department hardly returns phone calls and lies through her teeth! One time, I had to speak directly with the doctor about her (and make it a big deal out of the whole situation) just so she can "re-" send out my records in the mail that she had never mailed out in the first place. (Don't pee on my leg and tell me it's raining!) Also, there's an Asian (Chinese?) girl named Rachel who talks with a really rude, annoying and sarcastic tone. It just makes me feel very comfortable talking to her over the phone when I really need to get some stuff done.

Dr. Aksoy is my father's cardiologist. Our family gives him the highest praise. His diagnostic and clinical skills are extraordinary, his vigilance and attention to detail are commendable, and his obvious compassion and care for patients are deeply appreciated. Also noteworthy is his accessibility and the expediency to which he responds to questions and gives feedback. He is a rare and special practitioner who is a model for how to be a stellar physician and patient advocate. He is a gift to the field of cardiology!

My PCP diagnosed me with WPW Syndrome back in August and referred me to a cardiologist, who then referred me to Dr. Girsky after some more extensive tests. I was able to get in to see him very quickly and his staff was extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. He went over all of my options with me and described in detail the procedure I decided to have done. On the day of the procedure, I was very nervous but was very confident that I was in the right hands. The procedure went very well and Dr. Girsky answered all of the questions I had and also made sure I didn't have any other questions before he left. He has a great bedside manner and is very down to earth. I'm very happy that I had such an awesome doctor who did an amazing job at resolving my heart issue!

Dr. Sklansky is one of the best Dr.'s that we have been to. We only wish he was a General Pediatrician so we could visit him more! He is very knowledgable and personable. He takes his time to go above and beyond to give you peace of mind in his experience. Thank you Dr. Sklansky!
aka ANGEL ..... Excellent physician!!! Highly recommended to anyone at any age.

The best doctor I have ever seen! Very knowledgeable and helpful. Always takes plenty of time to answer your questions. She is also very patient, kind and caring. The perfect mix of clinical experience and bedside manner.
Outstanding, helpful, long years of experience, pioneer in new EP technologies using the new Cardioinsight vest.
sincere,prfessionaland excellent,honest,can<t be better than that

Dr. Watson is one of the most kind and caring physicians that I have ever seen. She is so knowledgeable in her field, when I left her office every question was answered and I learned so much. I could never express just how much I really appreciate her expertise and kindness. I wouldn't ever hesitate to recommend her to everyone for cardiac care.

He is new electrophysiologist in Beverly Hills who my cardiologist, Dr. Norman Lepor referred me to. He is at the Westside Medical Associates of Los Angeles which has a great reputation. He specializes in ablations of arrhythmias like atrial fibrilation and SVT. Great experience plus I trust Dr. Lepor and think he walks on water. He has excellent bedside manner and spent nearly an hour with me. He also puts in pacemakers and defibrillators. He is also very cute!!!!
saved my wifes life.operated on her enlarged aorta.

He is a heck of an expert (mine was a quadrupule bypass - open heart surgery for me). Very precise in performing a surgery: clean cuts in chest and leg. Very supportive to patient needs. Straight to the point, pays attention to details, listens carefully to his patients (and spouses), and sensitive to their needs. was recommended by several doctors to perform bypass. He is not interested in calling you for ever to take another appointment. Once you are healed and cured, and you are completely done, he says "Goodbye" and sees other waiting patients. Office appointments and communications with his nurse and secretary is professional, they also listen very much to your needs.
Recommend him strongly, superb physician

I thought Dr. Ford was gruff when I first met him and was quite unimpressed by his lack of a sense of humor. However, he grew on me quickly; he definitely knows what he's doing and has always been super helpful by calling me back at all hours and giving great advice and always being spot on with diagnoses. He is the best. I've just moved to Virginia now and am dreading another doctor because I really trusted Dr. Ford with my multiple health problems and was never afraid to see him like I am with other doctors...waaah. I miss him already. He's old-school in a charming way and the office doesn't take credit cards, but they will bill you.
very knowledgeable and helpfull, i will go back to see him !

Dr. Buch is an amazing doctor. When I first met him, I found him to be kind, knowledgeable and caring. He made me feel secure and confident. I am very grateful to have met Dr. Buch & highly recommend him without reservation. He has been a blessing!!!
If only all doctors were as good as he! He exceeds in all areas!
nice doctor who listened to me and understood my worries

I recovered from massive blockage due to Dr Parikh. He has moved and I need to find him.
wghh@aol.com
Thoughtfully listens to your need, examines the situation promptly and throughly, gives a clear diagnosis and recommendation, patiently answers questions.
Very thoughtful and available to answer your questions and quell your fears.
Awesome doctor. A little sassy with a dry humor but I appreciate that. :)

Dr. Cao is a specialist in internal medicine. I was referred to him by my family doctor a little over a year ago and have been very impressed about how well his office is run. Everyone on his staff is made me feel welcome and at ease about whatever procedure I was about to receive. I can remember the first time I entered his office and had to fill out the paper work that was needed anytime I see a new doctor for the first time. I have nerve damage in my writing hand and so I brought with me copies of all the information that I thought would necessary to fill out the required forms and when I told a member of his staff how illegible my hand writing would have been someone was there to help me through everything which made me feel comfortable already. Now I have been under Dr. Cao's care for over a year now I have come to notice how professionally his office is run. From the moment I enter his office I am always greeted by a member of his staff and I am made to feel like my care is of the upmost importance while I'm there. When it is time for my appointment they are always ready to take care of me. There aren't any delays as in other doctor's offices. He has enough staff on hand to make sure that I'm always taken care of properly. Everyone is there to see that you receive the best care while you are there ...... Now I know that is how a doctor's office supposed to be run, but actually so few are run that way! Dr. Cao is the person who I am sure is responsible for the professional treatment that I always receive when I'm in his office. If you are looking for a doctor who actually cares that you receive proper care then I highly recommend Dr. Michael Cao. if you are in need of his services...... Charles W. Hyatt
Spent lots of time. Had to wait but it was well worth it.
Very good service and freiendly staff Nice guy
Great doctor with a positive attitude who is very hard working ... Highly recommended.
Superb in every way
great doc and staff who are very nice and helpful to the patients
I am not a big fan of this physician. In my opinion, he is not a good person.
Dr. Schapira truly cares about his patients. I don't mind waiting, if he's not on time with his appointments, because I know he's helping someone who needs the help. I could be in the same situation.

OFFICE MANAGER (SUSAN) IS A DICTATOR WITHOUT ANY KNOWLEDGE AND OR COMPASSION FOR THE PEOPLE WHO COME TO SE THE DR,.. SHE IS RUDE AND SHOULD NOT BE WORKING IN THIS FIELD. THE DR WILL DO HIMSELF A GREAT SERVICE IF HE WOULD GET RID OF HER.
This doctor is not helpful, he just follows minimum standard of care without real care of patient.
A very experienced man who took a great deal of time to reolate to me. He knows his stuff.

For 5 yrs, I have never felt rushed or ignored, always treated w/concern & dignity, always felt I was getting the best treatment possible. Doctor is pleasant, attentive & caring. I credit his treatment w/extra years of quality life. He stabilized the heart failure.

He has been my son Andrew's Dr. now for 2+ years. he is an excellent Dr. and human being. He takes the time to listen to your questions and concerns. He actually takes what the parents have to say in consideration to the treatment he gives your child. Overall I could not have asked for a better Dr. for my son.
Treatment was very thorough, and I found that the Dr. was knowledgeable and helpful with any condition that was brought before him. I think he's a great Dr.
Still no problems w/pacemaker implantation, done May 2007. Done @ WLA-VAMC. Jim G
Dr. Alejos is a wonderful doctor and one that takes his time to explain everything. I would not choose another doctor for my son and I drive 200 miles to see him!

A year and 1/2 ago my two year old needed open heart surgery whoch was done by Dr. Hillel Laks at UCLA. Dr. Klitzner was her pediatric cardiologist during the months prior to surgery as well as in the succeeding months. He was and remains in my wife and my estimation a most compassionate, empathic, conscientious and knowledgable physician. We've felt tremendously well supported by his caring, open-mindedness and generosity with answers to any and all questions and concerns we've ever had. He's a gem!

Avoid this doctor! He's head of Cardiology at Mattel Children's, and shouldn't be. My teen found him cold, unsympathetic, and unprofessional. He blamed my child for his mistakes and told fibs to cover up his mistakes when he didn't really need to. For some reason, his other negative comments have been REMOVED! By him?! His agenda seems to be keeping his position at all costs. It's all about numbers and money with this guy. Avoid him! Yes, he went to a good school, but that certainly doesn't make him a good children's doctor.
Does not really care about the well being of his patients. Tend to be arrogant and uncaring.
maybe a good md. very unconcerned with your time.
He has not patience and is not sympathetic to his patients concerns. Does not like to be questioned and. Extremely poor bed side manners. I would not recommend this doctor.
HE NEARLY KILLED ME.HE DOES NOT LISTEN TO PATIENT SYMPTONS. I SHOULD HAVE BEEN TAKEN OFF STATINS 6 MONTHS BEFORE I GOT SERIOUSLY ILL.
Not attentive to his patients. He will wait more than 24 hours to consult with other doctors on serious matters. Would highly recommend looking for a different radio doctor.

The staff is horrible, you think you went to a bar in a bad neighborhood, the manager is the worst, the last thing she knows is how to work in professional office, and she should be a manager in 99 cent stores. The doctor is a little better than his staff, but he encourages his staff rude and impolite behavior, it seems it’s a family business. I wouldn’t recommend this office to anyone.

Cavalier attitude bordered on unprofessional. Did not explain test results in manner acceptable.
Visited with patient for only 5 minutes. Rushed off to another appointment. Was not responsive. Felt like an object.

If I could rate him 0 stars, I would. Unfortunately, this is one of the worst doctors I have ever been to. He is arrogant and does not listen. His explanations for events and symptoms are conflicting and confusing. He is condescending in tone and content. He regularly cuts me off, impatiently holding me accountable for not understanding his poor communicative efforts. He rushes me through appointments and I rarely leave with a sense of being in competent, caring hands. But, the worst offense is that he refuses to involve himself in any dialogue or acknowledgement of heart-related symptoms he cannot explain. If I experience heart palpitations or other cardiac arrhythmias that are not reflected in my heart monitor, he shames me for “wasting his time” (a literal quote) and only begrudgingly offers suggestions of who might be able to help me instead. That’s if I’m lucky. Otherwise, I clearly have a “psychiatric issue” that needs to be examined. Right. So, if you can’t explain the symptom, the only other plausible explanation must be that I’m crazy. Ironically, he has all the traits of a bona fide Narcissist. (Note: I am not a licensed psychiatric clinician, but simply stating my personal observation.)
Continuing along these lines, he resents answering questions, feeling that simply telling me “things are fine” should make my terrifying experiences magically disappear. I have a very serious cardiac condition and I do best when armed with information and a comprehensive understanding of my situation. One time when I asked for an explanation for the difference between the cardiac condition I once had and the one it now progressed to, he said, “It would be beyond your comprehension, so I will not explain it.” More like, you must not have a very keen grasp of the situation yourself, if you cannot break it down for your patients. The man is insufferable and insulting. He creates an enormously hostile environment where I leave more taxed than when I went in. The bulk of his patients are senior citizens who do not speak English as a first language. I am comparatively articulate in English. I shudder to think what he gets away with regarding patients who may not be in a position to put forth their needs more assertively.
God willing, my insurance will cover me finding a better, more ethical electrophysiologist.

Very unhappy with him, very cold, he's very impressed with himself. Difficult to reach the office by phone without having to go through voicemail. Office lost part of a test record and claim they never received it. I don't feel my mother received timely treatment
Very attentive. Listens to you. If you have questions, she will answer them. Takes her time with you.

my son was born with critical pulmonary stenosis. dr. rosengart, et al. performed a balloon angioplasty on my 3 - day old infant son and saved his life. he is extremely competent and has an exceptional bedside manner. he is truly an asset to his profession!!!

doctor_name: Dr. Helga Maria Louisa Van Herle
review: My condition clearly had symptoms that should have had the doctor referring me for thyroid medication. I suggested it but that was not the doctor's concern afterwards. Many symptoms should have been discussed between the cardiologist and the endocrinologist. They weren't.
If you need a pacemaker or ablation for atrial fibrillation, he's one of the best.
He is a great doctor. He also cross-cares for adults at USC medical and takes patients and integrates them into the adult doctor world.

Apparently she's one of the best Cardiologist's around but the bottom line is she rude, and indifferent. She kept leaving the examing room to take lenghty phone calls and knowing that I have a serious condition I left her office not knowing what to do other than to take some lasix. I'm frustrated and will seek care elsewhere.
Only interested in money. Has no insight in humaninty.
not a gentelman at all. more of a corporate style personality. not compassionate at all. should not have been a physician at all.

This office saw me one time. Perscibed a medication that would severely interact with the other medications I am taking. When we were leaving Dr. Shivkumar stood up and shook my husband's hand and said "that treat many JPL scientists here?" I was the patient and I am not a scientist. Then when I wrote a letter to them explaining my unhappiness over what was happening they dismissed me as a patient saying they could not meet my needs. These people only take the simple cases, Anything more difficult is way too hard for them. Also the nurse practitioners are acceptionally uncaring. Under no circumstances go to this place. Save yourself the trouble. You don't really see him any way. He is a sham artist! They kept on telling me different things when I called. UCLA Cardiac Arrhythmic Center is a REALLY REALLY bad place to go if you are having heart conduction problems and need real help! Also Dr. Shivkumar is a Chauvinist and treats men much better than women!!!!!!!!!!!! He is bad!

During my visit I felt that I was treated poorly.I would NEVER recommend this doctor to my family and friends.I felt this visit was a complete waste of time and money.Overall I would rate this visit : mediocre.

My mother was seen by Choi (can't even bring myself to call her a doctor) and she would come in for maybe a total of 3 minutes and just bang on her chest. My mother had just suffered a cardiac arrest and was induced into a coma, and she expected her to just get up and start talking to her. Well days went by when my mother began to respond to touch and familiar voices. Then when I wanted Choi to come by and check on my mom, she would sit behind the ICU desk for a couple of minutes and then just leave. She had the nerve to tell a cousin of mine that if my mother had been in her country she would no longer be alive (they would have taken her off the vent).
